intro: Peucedanum officinale subsp. longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features large, compound leaves with long, slender lobes, and its flowers are typically white or pale green, arranged in complex umbels. It is valued for its medicinal properties, with the roots and seeds used in traditional herbal remedies. However, it is considered a threatened species due to habitat loss and overharvesting.
